file_content.text: Maybe now the Voss will get off our backs.
The vorantiki are dead.
All of them? You're sure?
Perfect timing. Lord Serevin requested an update on the extermination. Glad I can finally give him some good news.
Those vorantiki were monsters. The Voss were right to be scared.
It wasn't easy.
I'd expect nothing less from something that made a meal out of my men.
Thanks to me.
The glory's all yours. I'm just relieved it got done.
Am I done?
Should be, unless the Voss think of more demands. But that's not your problem.
I suppose it's safe now to send out a search party, collect what's left of Bravo Team. Thanks for your assistance.
Remember, these aren't just any vorantiki you're hunting here.
I say again, Bravo Team, respond!
Nothing. That was my best unit, my lord. Eaten by monsters, if you can believe it.
Unbelievable. Another unit, gone. Eaten by monsters, of all things.
One of the local bigwigs had a bad dream about the things so now we're expected to wipe them out.
Sounds like you're the ones getting wiped out.
Not off to a good start.
You try hunting down a pack of nightmares.
Back up.
You're out here because of a... dream?
That's a weird assignment.
Ridiculous, isn't it?
Some Voss Mystic had a "vision, " saw Gormak leading a horde of vorantiki covered in tech augments. Sent the locals into an uproar.
They insist the creatures be exterminated, and Darth Serevin volunteered us for the job. Now I'm down a squad and no closer to killing those things.
I hope you're not questioning Lord Serevin's orders, Lieutenant.
Don't complain.
Of course not, my lord. Just tired of having to suck up to these people.
Nothing breeds loyalty like gratitude.
Serevin is smart.
An orbital bombardment would accomplish that just as well.
Unless the vorantiki are allergic to whining, I'd switch tactics.
Stop crying.
We're doing this without any concrete info on these things. Just some cryptic nonsense.
I hope you've got more reliable intel than a few hallucinations.
All this for a vision?
Negative. We're chasing phantoms here.
Have you actually seen any of these augmented vorantiki?
What do the beasts look like?
Not personally, but the Voss talk as if the Gormak mated a vorantikus with a trash compactor droid.
I doubt these things even exist. Just lie, say you already killed them.
They're probably not real.
Something ate my men. Lord Serevin will have my head if the same happens to the Voss.
The Empire's reputation is at stake here. We succeed, we'll look strong, capable. We fail....
Perhaps you could eliminate the vorantiki, my lord. Remind the Voss where our true strength lies.
The Voss need to see the Empire can get results. Can you poach those vorantiki for me, hunter?
Maybe you could deal with those vorantiki, sir. Show the Voss what the Empire's best and brightest are capable of.
I can't go back empty-handed. Can you take care of those vorantiki for me?
If it'll keep the locals happy.
I'll handle this.
Sure, why not?
Excellent. You'll find the teched-out vorantiki, or whatever ate my men, by this Gormak encampment...
I outfitted Bravo Team with some EMP grenades. Thought they might disrupt the vorantiki's tech augments.
Obviously the grenades weren't enough, but if you can find Bravo Team's remains, they might give you an edge against the beasts. Good luck.
No way. [Refuse quest]
I'm a dead man.
Bravo Team should have checked in by now.
